job_title: Patient Access Representative in Canton, OH
pros: Many locations to choose from
cons: Mercy professional care corporation management

pros: Co-workers are friendly and shuttle bus in the winter is nice.
cons:
Pharmacy management- Least caring and unprofessional leader I have even worked for. Treats people as if they are worthless and very demeaning. I have seen more turn over in the last several years than I thought was possible. These are great people that are simply looking to be treated with respect and value. It is a terrible place to be. 
Inconsistency and lack of safety controls.
Respect/Integrity- non existent here, the director does NOT communicate openly and honestly NOR does she keep her word and deliver on commitments. I have seen people put through the ringer for absolutely no reason other an ego trip. I have seen technicians promised raises after they undergo training only to be withheld for month or years. 
Excellence- NOT at Mercy. Leadership if anything stifles personal and professional growth unless you are a person that does not think for themselves and blindly follows a dictatorship style of management. This is a place of groupthink lead by individuals that truly believe they are the smartest people in the room. Innovation and acting in a manner to improve the delivery of quality and value to patients is met with a “this is the way we have always done it attitude.” That is just a poor business plan in a changing volume to value healthcare landscape.
Compassion- Leadership can’t even use it in a sentence. Enough said. 
Attitude- Poor leadership style. Fails to hold themselves accountable and quick to blame others. Leadership does not even attempt to collaborate and involve front line staff in decisions. My advice is DON’T work here.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Canton, OH
pros: Use all of my skills everyday!!!
cons: Very busy place to work.

pros: Wage, hours, cafeteria, break room
cons: Discrimination, bad insurance, lack of teamwork

pros: The employees that I worked with were nice.
cons: I was in a car accident on my way to work (not my fault as I was rear ended)  and since I was 6 months pregnant (Which mercy knew prior to my employment) I had to spend the day in labor and delivery triage to be monitored.  My manager never once asked if me or th baby were ok. She called me into her office to let me know that since I had to call off to go to the hospital from the accident and since my maternity leave fell into their “busy time” they had to let me go!!  Pure evil of a manager no wonder the longest employee there is less then 6 months!!  The manager knew about my maternity leave and when it would be prior to my employment. HR is just as bad, they said it didn’t matter why she fired me she can let me go for any reason she wants.

review_title: Mercy is the most poorly run hospital I have ever worked for
pros: Attempts to provide excellent patient care
cons: It seems that upper management does not listen to the experienced people who work the floors.  We have so much to offer yet it seems they keep making thing worse.  Nurses are totally pushed to being overwhelmed on a daily basis yet management refuses to listen, or try different idea's to improve.  They continue to cut staff and make our jobs almost intolerable.

pros: Catholic Values and a chapel to go to when stressed
cons: Pay was very low for position

review_title: Not the best hospital I’ve worked at.
pros: Flexible with scheduling, Everyone non nursing related was friendly.
cons: Low pay, short staffed, bad communication.

job_title: Executive Director Tech in Canton, OH
pros: You can gain a lot of great experience to apply to future careers or professional interests. Most co-workers are generally welcoming to new faces.
cons: The pay is absolutely terrible for the work that you have to do. I see a lot of favoritism towards select people. Some people simply are not willing to help one another -- you get the "that's not my job" or "that's not my patient" attitude frequently from other techs that are supposed to be supporting you. More commonly, some techs would rather gossip about you behind your back as opposed to correcting the issue that they're complaining about. A lot of backstabbing.

pros: I felt like most of my employment at Mercy was fair, except for my last position in the Information Services Department. I was hired with the idea that within a year I would be made full-time. That year came and went, and when I questioned my boss he said it was not in the budget. There were a few salaried employees hired during a 2 and a half year period, yet I was told my lower paying position was not in the budget. I still liked the job, and my co-workers for the most part.
cons: I wanted to work full-time instead of waiting for hours to come open to make hours to almost work full-time.

job_title: Director of Rehabilitation in Canton, OH
pros: We all work as a team and truly support the mission of continuing Christ’s healing ministry as we care for the whole person.  We are encouraged to serve the community through education.  You will see that   employees, physicians, and leaders at Mercy demonstrate compassion and empathy in decisions affecting patient care. Patient safety is always a focus, and each person’s views and needs are respected. It is not uncommon to see an employee make the time to listen, console, encourage, or pray with a patient.  Mercy leaders do not forget to celebrate our successes.
cons: There are both private and semi-private rooms in the hospital.  There is a plan to move to all private rooms, and you can see actions are occurring to get there soon.

pros: Positive mission and values; friendly staff; considerate patient care.
cons: Some departments/individuals don't align themselves with the values of the institution which created conflict for me. The department I worked in didn't seem to 'play by the rules' which made me feel frustrated.  It would seem important for an institution with a strong religious/humanitarian mission to have department managers, who choose to work there, support these values in their individual areas.  At times, my department was a real embarassment  in it's general attitude toward the people they served.

review_title: Its a good place to work
pros: Cafeteria food and selections.  Prices. Great people. Loved my manager!!!! Great back to school opportunities and benefits  for ones that can do that.
cons: Shift hours were changed on me then hours cut due to budget cuts. They will use all PTO time and so you never could get use it for a vacation time off.  Low pay too opposed to other hospitals. ER was insane. If you cant handle stress, or tragedy I don't recommend trying this job.

pros: Some of the coworkers are nice and the nurses in Maternity.
cons:
1) Management is horrible: they do not talk to each other, they play favorites, they make you feel awful about your work, they all tell you something different about how to do something and yell at you when you don’t do it their way, etc.
2) Drama: so much estrogen in one place. And some of the floor guys do not help it. Be prepared.
3) Nurses: floors 7, 5, and occasionally others like 10 will blame you for everything. They are not nice people. There are exceptions but a lot will go out of their way to make you feel unwelcome. 

All in all go to Aultman, Union, Akron, or Summa. Literally picking up trash is better than being in this department.

pros: There were a few doctors that I really loved to work with in the O.R, a couple employees were really cool and I enjoyed working with them.
cons: The management it's the worst I've ever seen. If you didn't get into one of the little cliques there you definitely would not last long. The place is a turnover machine. They were practically new faces there every day. And the way they treated some of their employees that have been there for a couple years was appalling. I don't even know why they stay there.

pros: I used to love working here until new mgmt  is pushing long term employees out for no reason except jealousy.
cons: Mgmt let's lower mgmt lie and get away with it. Mercy is not the same Mercy anymore...it's about who ya know...used to be about the patients. Leaving soon because. Mgmt lies

pros: Lots of challenges both professionally and personally.  Good people with kind hearts, actually care what happens to coworkers and patients.  Facility location easy to get to.
cons: Communication, structured work environment along with accountability could have stronger support.  Less passing judgement on one situation and one side, all parties need heard.  Human resource staff less judgemental and look at all possibilities and once situation has passed several years without further incident allow all parties to move past it.

pros: Spirituality of the company was the primary reason I worked here. The staff truly care about the outcomes of patients. Managers are awesome for the most part. Pay was comparable, PTO was comparable.
cons: Financial struggles of the hospital have led to cutbacks on services, not direct patient care. Parking was a challenge, even though a shuttle bus brought you to and from your vehicle during the winter months.

pros:
Work atmosphere was pleasant, if you're used to the city and its idiosyncrasies.
Benefits were nice, as were the regular pay raises. Keeps you on your toes, literally.
cons: Management was a bit stiff and equipment was often disregarded and in disrepair, if not completely outdated.

review_title: Thankful for a job, but horrified how this place is managed!!!
pros: Good people to work with.
cons: Departmental Management if horrible!!  No one follows Company policies!  The pay scale is so low I don't know how they expect people to live...

pros: Good pay and great benefits
cons: They are downsizing many departments, such as mine. They have laid off people without any notice. It is just a big business, not a "caring hospital" as they promote.

pros: Most coworkers are great to work with
cons: Low pay. The point system is ridiculous. You get points if you get sent home for being sick. You get points for calling off sick. Points for being 5 minutes late. Staffing is also insanity. Some floors will have 2-3 aides because they're a telemetry floor while the nontelemetry floors will have 1 aide.

review_title: My experience has been overall positive. Great coworkers and boss.
pros: They are a faith based hospital and offer great benefits.
cons: They are short staffed and sometimes have to close their outpatient facilities early or for the whole day because of not finding proper coverage.
